alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 04 at 4:03PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM HST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE ISLAND OF MAUI IN MAUI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Maui in Maui County. * WHEN...Until 515 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 355 PM HST, radar trends show that the widespread heavy rainfall from earlier, has begun to diminish across the area. However, some locally heavy rainfall continues across Nahiku and Hana. Rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour in heavier showers. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kaupo, Kipahulu, Kula, Keokea, Nahiku, Ulupalakua, Hana, Wailea, Makena, Haleakala National Park and Hamoa. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 515 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
